papers.title: Intravenous iron in ICU anaemia: a pragmatic randomized trial
papers.abstract_html: This pragmatic randomized trial in adult ICU patients evaluated IV ferric carboxymaltose versus standard care...
papers.summary_html:
PICO
P: Adult ICU with anaemia; I: IV ferric carboxymaltose; C: usual care; O: transfusion by day 14.
Primary outcome
Risk difference −8% (95% CI −15 to −1).
Key secondary
Hb +9 g/L at day 14; LOS similar.
Safety
No excess infections or thrombosis observed.
Risk of bias (Cochrane)
Some concerns — allocation concealment unclear.
Subgroups
No prespecified subgroups with differential effects.
